column4: hmm.  I appear to have a new problem.  I loaded stepmania, it started up and gave me a black screen.  I quit and i have a black screen with a mouse cursor.  What do i do now?
yah, that's what i thought
so, uhm, can anyone tell me how i fix this issue?
Ok, so, black screen, responsive mouse cursor, nfc what to do now... anyone?
ctl-alt-backspace
nothing happened
X is hung. alt-f2
what do i do after alt-f2 fails?
power off
- i broke it good.  It told me it couldnt start x and dumped me at a terminal, telling me to start x when it was configured correctly
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
I don't know most of these options... is there a way to make it run the autodetect it did on install?
nope
this is mhy if you don't know how soething works you *don't take it apart*
Ubuntu has a package system. until you learn more, do not try to install and run anything outside the package system.
am i going to have to reinstall the whole system now?  i ran the config as best i could, tried startx and got Fatal server error: no screens found

yup. sounds like your X cofig is totally FUBAR. it could be fixed, but it's prolly faster for you to just reinstall. and while you do it, repeat the mantra "i will only use software from official repositories."
Lol.  If the official repository ddr-clone worked instead of dying instantly, i wouldnt have had to.
you *had* to install a DDR clone? lives hung in the balance?
There wouldnt be much point in changing OS's to one that doesn't run what i need to run, would there be?
i din't tell you to change OSes.

That's completely accurate.  I chose to attempt to migrate from windows to have cleaner teeth, perfect hair, and to be a better human being.  You're the individual in this channel who's been supplying me with some help on the subject, for which i am grateful.
Are you still here?
